doc.ContractDescription: THE GEOSTATIONARY TRACE GAS AND AEROSOL SENSOR OPTIMIZATION GEOTASO INSTRUMENT LEITCH 2014 WAS DEVELOPED BY BALL AEROSPACE UNDER NASAS INSTRUMENT INCUBATOR PROGRAM AS A TEST BED INSTRUMENT FOR THE GEOSTATIONARY COASTAL AND AIR POLLUTION EVENTS GEO CAPE DECADAL SURVEY MISSION FISHMAN 2012. GEOTASO IS NOW ALSO A TEST BED FOR THE UPCOMING U.S. TROPOSPHERIC EMISSIONS MONITORING OF POLLUTION TEMPO ZOOGMAN 2016 AND KOREAN GEOSTATIONARY ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING SPECTROMETER GEMS GEOSTATIONARY AIR QUALITY MISSIONS, WHICH ARE SCHEDULED FOR LAUNCH WITHIN THE NEXT FIVE YEARS. IN THIS CAPACITY, GEOTASO ACTS AS A SATELLITE ANALOG FOR AIR QUALITY FIELD CAMPAIGNS, AND WILL BE A VALIDATION INSTRUMENT AFTER SATELLITE MISSION ARE ON ORBIT. GEOTASO HAS PARTICIPATED IN AIR QUALITY FIELD CAMPAIGNS IN TEXAS DISCOVER AQ 2013, COLORADO DISCOVER AQ 2014 AND SOUTH KOREA KORUS AQ 2016.

doc.ContractDescription: STAR FORMATION, IN BOTH ITS NORMAL AND ACTIVE BURST PHASES, DRIVES AND IS DRIVEN BY THE PHYSICAL CONDITIONS IN GALAXIES THAT ARE FORMING STARS, FROM MASSIVE OUTFLOWS TO THE HEATING OF DUST. IT ALSO GOVERNS THE EVOLUTION OF METALLICITY, ENRICHMENT OF THE IGM, AND MANY OTHER PROCESSES. TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE PHYSICAL CONDITIONS THAT INITIATE - AND QUENCH - STAR FORMATION, INCLUDING ITS APPARENT SYMBIOTIC RELATIONSHIP WITH AGN ACTIVITY IN LATER-STAGE MERGERS, WE PROPOSE THE FIRST LARGE AND COHERENT RADIATIVE TRANSFER STUDY OF THE EXTREME OBJECTS THAT ARE FORMING STARS MOST RAPIDLY: THE LUMINOUS AND ULTRALUMINOUS INFRARED GALAXIES (LIRGS AND ULIRGS). OUR STUDY WILL BE BASED ON RADIATIVE TRANSFER MODELING OF ALL (U)LIRGS WITH RELIABLE ARCHIVAL HERSCHEL/SPIRE AND PACS MOLECULAR SPECTRA. OUR GOALS ARE TO (1) MODEL THE CONDITIONS IN THE DENSE CIRCUMNUCLEAR GAS CLOUDS AS A FUNCTION OF LFIR, M(H2), AND MERGER STAGE, AND TO DERIVE STAR FORMATION RATES (SFR), RADIATION PRESSURE, DUST AND GAS TEMPERATURES, OPTICAL DEPTHS, AND GAS DEPLETION RATES; (2) UNDERSTAND THE NUCLEAR MOLECULAR OUTFLOW/INFLOW PHENOMENA AND HOW AND WHY THEY DIFFER FOR LIRGS (LOG[LIR/LSUN]>11) AND ULIRGS (LOG[LIR/LSUN]>12); AND (3) TEST THE REALITY OF THE TWO PUTATIVE MODES OF STAR FORMATION (MAIN SEQUENCE AND STARBURST) AS A FUNCTION OF GALAXY LUMINOSITY AND MERGER STAGE, QUANTIFY THE DIFFERENCES, AND REVEAL THE PHYSICAL CAUSES (MERGER PROPERTIES, IMF DIFFERENCES, ETC.)
doc.MajorAgency: THE PHYSICAL AND CHEMICAL CONDITIONS IN LUMINOUS G
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE PHYSICAL AND CHEMICAL CONDITIONS IN LUMINOUS G

doc.ContractDescription: LPI CHASSIS ASSY,2U

HIGH RESOLUTION ADJUSTABLE MIRROR CONTROL FOR X-RAY ASTRONOMY WE PROPOSE TO BUILD AND TEST THIN FILM TRANSISTOR CONTROL CIRCUITRY FOR A NEW HIGH-RESOLUTION ADJUSTABLE X-RAY MIRROR TECHNOLOGY. THIS CONTROL CIRCUITRY WILL GREATLY SIMPLIFY THE WIRING SCHEME TO ADDRESS INDIVIDUAL ACTUATOR CELLS. THE RESULT WILL BE A TRANSFORMATIVE IMPROVEMENT FOR THE X-RAY SURVEYOR MISSION CONCEPT: MATHEMATICAL MODELS, WHICH FIT THE EXPERIMENTAL DATA QUITE WELL, INDICATE THAT 0.5 ARCSECOND IMAGING IS FEASIBLE THROUGH THIS TECHNIQUE UTILIZING THIN SLUMPED GLASS SUBSTRATES WITH UNCORRECTED ANGULAR RESOLUTION OF ORDER 5-10 ARCSECONDS. IN ORDER TO CORRECT FOR FIGURES ERRORS IN A TELESCOPE WITH SEVERAL SQUARE METERS OF COLLECTING AREA, MILLIONS OF ACTUATOR CELLS MUST BE SET AND HELD AT SPECIFIC VOLTAGES. IT IS CLEARLY NOT FEASIBLE TO DO THIS VIA MILLIONS OF WIRES, EACH ONE CONNECTED TO AN ACTUATOR. INSTEAD, WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP AND TEST THIN-FILM TECHNOLOGY THAT OPERATES ON THE SAME PRINCIPLE AS MEGAPIXEL COMPUTER SCREENS. WE WILL DEVELOP THE TECHNOLOGIES NEEDED TO BUILD THIN FILM PIEZOELECTRIC ACTUATORS, CONTROLLED BY THIN FILM ZNO TRANSISTORS, ON FLEXIBLE POLYIMIDE FILMS, AND TO CONNECT THOSE FILMS TO THE BACK SURFACES OF X-RAY MIRRORS ON THIN GLASS SUBSTRATES WITHOUT DEFORMING THE SURFACE. THESE TECHNOLOGIES REPRESENT A PROMISING AVENUE OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF MIRRORS FOR THE X-RAY SURVEYOR MISSION CONCEPT. SUCH A TELESCOPE WILL MAKE POSSIBLE DETAILED STUDIES OF A WIDE VARIETY OF ASTROPHYSICAL SOURCES. ONE EXAMPLE IS THE WARM-HOT INTERGALACTIC MEDIUM (WHIM), WHICH IS THOUGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR A LARGE FRACTION OF THE NORMAL MATTER IN THE UNIVERSE BUT WHICH HAS NOT BEEN DETECTED UNAMBIGUOUSLY TO DATE. ANOTHER IS THE GROWTH OF SUPERMASSIVE BLACK HOLES IN THE EARLY UNIVERSE. THIS PROPOSAL SUPPORTS NASA'S GOALS OF TECHNICAL ADVANCEMENT OF TECHNOLOGIES SUITABLE FOR FUTURE MISSIONS, AND TRAINING OF GRADUATE STUDENTS.

doc.ContractDescription: THE PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED WORK IS TO INVESTIGATE EMERGING ACTIVE REGIONS AND LOOK FOR POTENTIAL PRECURSOR INDICATORS OF THEIR EMERGENCE. THE DISCOVERY OF A PROPAGATION TIME ANOMALY AS A PRECURSOR TO THE EMERGENCE OF AR 10488 USING A MODIFIED TIME-DISTANCE ANALYSIS OF MDI OBSERVATIONS HAS LED TO A FLURRY OF STUDIES ON EMERGING REGIONS. SINCE THE INITIAL PAPER (2011), SEVERAL INVESTIGATORS HAVE TRIED TO REPRODUCE THESE RESULTS, TO APPLY THAT ANALYSIS TO OTHER ACTIVE REGIONS AND TO EXPLAIN WHY SUCH A PRECURSOR HAS SO FAR ONLY BEEN SEEN IN ONE OCCASION. MISSION DATA: THIS PROPOSAL WILL DRAW EXTENSIVELY FROM TWO DATA SETS PRODUCED BY TWO MISSIONS OF THE HELIO-PHYSICS SYSTEM OBSERVATORY: PRIMARILY HMI ON SDO, COMPLEMENTED BY MDI ON SOHO. DATA ANALYSIS METHODOLOGY: WE PROPOSE TO APPLY THE PI'S EXPERTISE IN BOTH PRECISE AND DETAILED DATA PROCESSING, AND SPECIFICALLY IN TIME-DISTANCE ANALYSIS TO THE PUZZLE OF EMERGENCE PRECURSORS, USING PRIMARILY HMI OBSERVATIONS. WE HAVE A SUBSTANTIAL SET OF OBSERVATIONS TO IDENTIFY A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF "SIMPLE" AND "WELL OBSERVED" EMERGING ACTIVE REGIONS. THESE ARE REGIONS LOCATED CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE EQUATOR AND EMERGING AT TIMES WHEN THE REGION IS ALSO CLOSE TO THE CENTRAL MERIDIAN. INDEED, SUCH REGIONS ALLOW US TO BOTH ENSURE DATA SETS OF HIGH SPATIAL RESOLUTION AND TO FOLLOW THE REGIONS WITH ADEQUATE SPATIAL RESOLUTION BEFORE AND AFTER THEIR EMERGENCE. WE PROPOSE TO ADAPT AND APPLY THE PI'S TIME DISTANCE DATA ANALYSIS PROCEDURE TO INVESTIGATE THE PRESENCE OR ABSENCE OF PRECURSOR INDICATORS. THE NITTY-GRITTY DETAILS OF THE DATA PROCESSING SEEM TO AFFECT IN STILL MYSTERIOUS WAYS THE DETECTION (OR THE NON-DETECTION) OF A PRECURSOR INDICATOR. IT IS THEREFORE IMPORTANT TO DEVELOP INDEPENDENT APPROACHES TO THE ANALYSIS TO CONFIRM OR NOT WHAT IN THE ANALYSIS OR THE REGIONS LEAD TO THE DETECTION OF A PRECURSOR INDICATOR. ALSO, PRECURSOR INDICATORS HAVE SO FAR NOT BEEN OBSERVED FOR MOST EMERGING ACTIVE REGIONS. IT IS THEREFORE KEY TO FIGURE OUT WHICH, IF ANY, OF THE PROPERTIES OF THE EMERGING REGION LEADS TO THE POTENTIAL DETECTION OF SUCH PRECURSOR INDICATOR. WE PROPOSE TO CARRY OUT A SYSTEMATIC STUDY OF A LARGE SET OF REGIONS TO DERIVE STATISTICALLY SIGNIFICANT INFERENCES OF PRECURSOR INDICATOR DETECTABILITY. RELEVANCE OF THE PROBLEM: THIS PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE SUN'S NEAR-SURFACE LAYERS AND THE PROCESSES THAT DRIVE ITS ACTIVITY CYCLE. A KEY QUESTION THAT THIS WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ANSWERING IS "HOW AND WHY DOES THE SUN VARY?" BY STUDYING EMERGING ACTIVE REGIONS AND DERIVING EITHER POTENTIAL PRECURSOR INDICATORS, OR EXPLAINING WHY THESE PRECURSORS ARE PRESENT ONLY IN SOME SPECIFIC CASES, WE EXPECT TO CONTRIBUTE TO OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE CHARACTERISTICS (LIKE TOPOLOGY) OF THE ACTIVE REGION AS IT IS ABOUT TO EMERGE. A CENTRAL QUESTION OF HELIOSPHERIC RESEARCH IS TO UNDERSTAND THE ORIGIN OF SOLAR MAGNETIC FIELDS. THE SUN EXHIBITS 22-YEAR CYCLES OF GLOBAL MAGNETIC ACTIVITY INVOLVING MAGNETIC REGIONS VISIBLE AT THE SURFACE WITH VERY WELL-DEFINED POLARITY RULES, RESULTING IN GLOBAL SCALE MAGNETIC PATTERNS. COEXISTING WITH THESE LARGE-SCALE STRUCTURES AND CONCENTRATED ACTIVE REGIONS ARE EPHEMERAL ACTIVE REGIONS AND OTHER COMPACT AND INTENSE FLUX STRUCTURES THAT EMERGE RANDOMLY OVER MUCH OF THE SOLAR SURFACE FORMING A "MAGNETIC CARPET." THE EXTENSION TO THE SOLAR ATMOSPHERE OF THESE CHANGING FIELDS AT ALL SCALES CREATES CORONAL ACTIVITY, WHICH IN TURN IS THE SOURCE OF SPACE WEATHER VARIABILITY.
doc.MajorAgency: TIME-DISTANCE STUDY OF EMERGING ACTIVE REGIONS USI
doc.MajorFundingAgency: TIME-DISTANCE STUDY OF EMERGING ACTIVE REGIONS USI

doc.ContractDescription: THE INSTITUTE FOR SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AT BOSTON COLLEGE (BC/ISR) PROPOSES TO HOST AND COORDINATE THE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES OF THE INTERNATIONAL SPACE WEATHER INITIATIVE (ISWI) PROGRAM. BOSTON COLLEGE S PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE TO PROMOTE EDUCATION, TRAINING AND OUTREACH TO ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT SPACE SCIENCE COURSES UNDER THE ISWI PROGRAM. THIS WILL BE DONE BY ORGANIZING ANNUAL WORKSHOPS OR SCHOOLS ON SPACE SCIENCE IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES.OUR PROPOSAL INCLUDES ORGANIZING A WORKSHOP OR SCHOOL IN EACH OF THE THREE YEARS OF THIS EFFORT. AT THIS TIME, OUR PROPOSAL INCLUDES HOSTING THESE EVENTS IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES IN EASTERN EUROPE; IN CENTRAL OR EAST AFRICA; AND IN ASIA. WE ALSO PROPOSE TO INITIATE OUR EFFORTS BY PARTICIPATING IN THE UPCOMING UN/JAPAN WORKSHOP ON SPACE WEATHER FROM ISWI INSTRUMENTS TO BE HELD IN MARCH 2015 IN FUKUOKA, JAPAN. BC/ISR SCIENTISTS HAVE BEEN VERY ACTIVE IN THE ISWI PROGRAM BY SUPPORTING AND DEPLOYING INSTRUMENTS, PERFORMING STATE OF THE ART SPACE WEATHER RESEARCH, PARTICIPATING IN INTERNATIONAL HELIOPHYSICAL YEAR (IHY) AND ISWI WORKSHOPS AND OUR ESTABLISHED SUCCESS IN DESIGNING TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AND WORKSHOPS WITH PARTICIPANTS FROM DEVELOPING COUNTRIES. IF AWARDED THIS OPPORTUNITY, BOSTON COLLEGE WILL SEEK ADDITIONAL SOURCES OF FUNDING FOR THE OUTREACH ACTIVITIES AND WORK CLOSELY WITH THE ISWI SECRETARIAT, SPONSORS AND STEERING COMMITTEE TO CONTINUE THE GREAT TRADITION OF THE ISWI MODEL FOR SCHOOLS AND WORKSHOPS.

doc.ContractDescription: T-SPOT TB TESTS

WE PROPOSE A FIVE-YEAR PROGRAM OF RESEARCH TO CONTINUE AND ENHANCE THE SMITHSONIAN ASTROPHYSICAL OBSERVATORY (SAO) COLLABORATION WITH KOREAN SCIENTISTS ON THE GEOSTATIONARY ENVIRONMENT MONITORING SPECTROMETER (GEMS) MISSION. GEMS IS TO BE LAUNCHED IN 2018 ON THE KOREAN GEO KOMPSAT 2B SATELLITE, TO MAKE GEOSTATIONARY MEASUREMENTS OF GASES, AEROSOLS, AND CLOUDS OVER ASIA. WE WILL CONTINUE OUR ONGOING COLLABORATION WITH THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR, PROFESSOR JHOON KIM OF YONSEI UNIVERSITY, DIRECTOR OF THE GLOBAL ENVIRONMENT SATELLITE RESEARCH CENTER (GESC), ALONG WITH COLLEAGUES AT SEOUL NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, PUSAN UNIVERSITY, THE GWANGJU INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY (GIST) AND THE KOREA AEROSPACE RESEARCH INSTITUTE (KARI). WE PROPOSE TO: 1. CONTINUE RADIANCE AND SYNTHETIC RETRIEVAL STUDIES IN SUPPORT OF GEMS INSTRUMENT AND MISSION DEVELOPMENT; 2. PROVIDE IMPROVED REFERENCE DATA, INCLUDING CALIBRATED REFERENCE SPECTRA, RAMAN SCATTERING CROSS SECTIONS, AND SOLAR IRRADIANCE; 3. PROVIDE IMPROVE SPECTRAL FITTING ALGORITHMS FOR GAS PROFILES AND TROPOSPHERIC ABUNDANCES AS SCIENTIFIC CODE AND COLLABORATE WITH GEMS SCIENTISTS TO IMPLEMENT OPERATION ALGORITHMS; 4. PROVIDE TEST SPECTRA DERIVED FROM OZONE MONITORING INSTRUMENT (OMI) AND GLOBAL OZONE MONITORING EXPERIMENT (GOME). THESE WILL BE DEGRADED TO GEMS RESOLUTION AND, IF NECESSARY, SIGNAL-TO-NOISE RATIOS TO PROVIDE DATA FOR ALGORITHM TESTING AND REFINEMENT. 5. CONSULT AND CONTRIBUTE ON OTHER GEMS ISSUES AS REQUESTED BY GESC AND THE GEMS SCIENCE TEAM.

CO: TRINA BELLAMY 609-485-7483 COR: LOA: 1216CT064110/A11D.560.SDS.1601/25102/CTG2500000/1288800160/6DA000 ROUTING: APPROVER: ISIDORE VENETOS FUND CERTIFIER: ELIZABETH DELAROSBY REQUESTED AWARD DATE IS BASED ON EXISTING CONTRACT SCHEDULE AND LEAD TIME EXPECTED FOR EQUIPMENT AVAILABILITY.
IGF::CT::IGF LONG RANGE BROAD AGENCY ANNOUNCEMENT (BAA) FOR NAVY AND MARINE CORPS SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
doc.ProductorServiceCode: AD91: R&D- DEFENSE OTHER: OTHER (BASIC RESEARCH)

doc.ContractDescription: SCOPE OF WORK THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE UMASS GROUP IS DETAILED IN THE JAXA PROPOSAL, INTERFACIAL PHENOMENA AND THERMAL PROPERTIES OF HIGH-TEMPERATURE MELTS, M. WATANABE, PI. THE ORIGINAL PROPOSAL (IN JAPANESE) AND A MACHINE TRANSLATION ARE ATTACHED FOR REFERENCE. OUR PROPOSED SCOPE OF WORK IS SUMMARIZED BELOW. 1. SIMULATION OF THE FLOW IN ELECTROSTATICALLY LEVITATED CORE-SHELL DROPLETS, INCLUDING DYNAMICS SUCH AS OSCILLATIONS AND VISCOUS EFFECTS ON THE DYNAMICS. 2. SIMULATION OF THE EFFECT OF CHANGES IN THE DIMENSIONS OF THE CORE AND SHELL ON THE SURFACE OSCILLATIONS. 3. SIMULATION OF THE TIME DEPENDENCE OF THE CHANGES IN SURFACE OSCILLATIONS DUE TO REACTIONS BETWEEN THE OXIDE AND STEEL PHASES. 4. DESIGN, DIRECT, AND ANALYZE EXPERIMENTS TO BE CONDUCTED IN THE MSFC ELECTROSTATIC LEVITATION FACILITY.
doc.MajorAgency: MODELING AND SIMULATION OF ELECTROSTATICALLY LEVIT
doc.MajorFundingAgency: MODELING AND SIMULATION OF ELECTROSTATICALLY LEVIT

doc.ContractDescription: OPEN INNOVATION RESEARCH AND PUBLICATION - CONNECT AND LINK EXISTING SOCIAL SCIENCE RESEARCH ON OPEN INNOVATION SYSTEMS TO THE PROBLEMS OF INSTITUTIONAL GOVERNANCE; IDENTIFY, DESIGN AND EXECUTE FIELD EXPERIMENTS IN OPEN GOVERNANCE; WORK WITH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS AND PROBLEMS WITHIN NASA THAT ARE OPEN TO FIELD EXPERIMENTAL METHODS AND TREATMENTS. EXECUTION IN SCIENTIFIC BASED FORMULATION OF CONTEST AND USE OF DATA SCIENCE - WORK WITH NASA AND OTHER PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS TO FURTHER DEVELOP EXECUTABLE CONTEST MODELS PARTICULARLY AROUND ALGORITHM AND DATA SCIENCE PROBLEMS. OPEN INNOVATION RESEARCH EDUCATION - PARTICIPATE IN RESEARCH DISSEMINATION ACTIVITIES WITHIN NASA AND OTHER AFFILIATED STAKEHOLDERS.
doc.MajorAgency: CROWD INNOVATION LABORATORY AT HARVARD UNIVERSITY
doc.MajorFundingAgency: CROWD INNOVATION LABORATORY AT HARVARD UNIVERSITY

doc.ContractDescription: KEY OBJECTIVES: EARTH SCIENTISTS ARE STRUGGLING TO EXTRACT NEW INSIGHTS FROM A SEA OF LARGE DATA SETS ORIGINATING FROM MULTIPLE INSTRUMENTS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PROVIDE ENHANCED ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE THE MOST BENEFICIAL DIVISION BETWEEN HUMAN AND MACHINE EFFORTS. WE PROPOSE THE CREATION OF ENHANCED ENVIRONMENTS FOR COMPUTER-AIDED DISCOVERY THAT SUPPORT HUMANS IN THE SEARCH PROCESS OF MAKING NEW DISCOVERIES RELATED TO EARTH SURFACE DEFORMATION PHENOMENA.
doc.MajorAgency: COMPUTER-AIDED DISCOVERY OF EARTH SURFACE DEFORMAT
doc.MajorFundingAgency: COMPUTER-AIDED DISCOVERY OF EARTH SURFACE DEFORMAT

doc.ContractDescription: THIS PROPOSAL COVERS AN AUGMENTATION OF NASA GRANT NNX10AR71G UNIFIED SUPPORT FOR THERMOLAB-ISS ICOPROSOL AND PARSEC. THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE RENEWAL REQUEST IS ANALYSIS OF CAVITATION-INDUCED NUCLEATION EXPERIMENTS FOR ZR FLIGHT SAMPLE BATCH 1 #18. PLANNING OF SURFACE TENSION MEASUREMENTS FOR ZR AND ZR O FLIGHT SAMPLES BATCHES 1-3. ANALYSIS OF SURFACE TENSION DATA FOR ZR AND ZR O FLIGHT SAMPLES TO INVESTIGATE THE INFLUENCE OF OXYGEN. PLANNING OF TURBULENT TRANSITION EXPERIMENTS FOR PD82SI18 SAMPLE BATCH 4. CONTINUE FLIGHT PREPARATIONS FOR BATCH 2 AS DESCRIBED BELOW. CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF PARAMETER SET FOR ZR O FLIGHT SAMPLES. CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT AND PLANNING FOR BATCH 2 SAMPLES AS DESCRIBED BELOW. DEVELOPMENT OF PARAMETER SET FOR PD82SI18 FLIGHT SAMPLE FOR BATCH 4.
doc.MajorAgency: UNIFIED SUPPORT FOR THERMOLAB-ISS, ICOPROSOL, AND
